get.description:
Provides ability to get status on a previously submitted Multi-Process job.

Note: This API is available as part of "Company Entity Resolution" Non Standard Data Blocks.

transactionDetail.description: The information used to process this request.

transactionID.description: A value assigned by the Dun & Bradstreet application to uniquely identify this request.

transactionTimestamp.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 UTC Z standard, when this response was created.

code.description: A unique code assigned by Dun & Bradstreet to identify the status of this request. See the Error and Information Code list for more information.

message.example: A message appropriate to the request outcome.
message.description: The description assigned to the information code.

requestDetail.description: The details of the input data provided.

jobID.description: The Job ID included in the request.
A unique identifier assigned by the Dun & Bradstreet application to identify this service request. The reference can be used to track the status of the process and retrieve the output when processed.

outputDetail.description: The details of the data returned by Dun & Bradstreet when the requested job is complete. The details in this section are needed to perform subsequent steps to download the output file.

contentURL.description: The URL from which the file generated by the process can be downloaded. This is the pre-signed URL with for the S3 folder dynamically assigned to each request. This URL includes security credentials, bucket name or object key, an HTTP method (PUT of uploading objects) and an expiration date and time. The URL is valid only for the specified duration.

urlMethod.description: The HTTP method that should be used to upload input files to assigned S3 URL. HTTP method PUT is used for uploading objects.

urlExpirationTimestamp.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 UTC Z standards, the URL will expire. File must be downloaded before this time.

parameters.name: jobID
parameters.description: A unique identifier assigned by the Dun & Bradstreet application to identify this service request. The reference can be used to track the status of the process and retrieve the output when processed.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The access token provided by authentication.

parameters.name: Customer-Key
parameters.description: A unique key provided by the customer while submitting a job; this key will be used to calculate the signature of the S3 pre-signed-url. The customer should retain this key to access the S3 folder to upload the input file.
